notes.title: Exploitability

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: Red Lion Controls Crimson 3.0 versions 707.000 and prior, Crimson 3.1 versions 3126.001 and prior, and Crimson 3.2 versions 3.2.0044.0 and prior are vulnerable to path traversal. When attempting to open a file using a specific path, the user's password hash is sent to an arbitrary host. This could allow an attacker to obtain user credential hashes.CVE-2022-3090 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Users should avoid opening files originating from outside the organization.
Users should verify files come from a trusted source prior to opening.
For more information and details, see Red Lion Security Bulletin RLCSB-2022ST31.
